content.text:
# Louisiana Historical Society

Louisiana Historical Society, established in 1835, is a historical society in Louisiana charged with documentation and protection of colonial records. According to its website, it is the oldest historical organization in the state.
The society has a long history of publishings, including the . Physical items from their collection are frequently displayed at The Cabildo, whose preservation the Society was involved with. Among the items in their collection are a souvenir program marking the centennial of the Louisiana Purchase, a Napoleon death mask made by his personal physician Francesco Antommarchi, and items related to the centennial of steam service on the Mississippi River.
Alc√©e Fortier served as the society's president from 1894 to 1912.
